title: Plagiarism Checker
original_prompt: I want you to act as a plagiarism checker. I will give you text1 and text2. I just want you to give me a overall similarity percentage. Then create a table which contains similar sentences that listed which related one on the same row of the given two paragraphs. Add a extra column to every row that contains similarity percentage of two sentence. Then give me an explanation about whether there is plagiarism or not. Do not write explanations on replies. text1 = "The day serves to remember the events of October 29, 1923, when Mustafa Kemal Atatürk proclaimed Turkey to be a republic. Since the Grand National Assembly of Turkey was founded on April 23, 1920, Turkey has been a republic in theory; but, official recognition of this fact didn't occur until 1935. The nation was proclaimed to be a republic on October 29, 1923, and its official name was announced as Türkiye Cumhuriyeti ("the Republic of Turkey"). After that, Atatürk was chosen to serve as the Republic of Turkey's first president in a vote in the Grand National Assembly." text2 = "The holiday commemorates the events of 29 October 1923, when Mustafa Kemal Atatürk declared that Turkey was henceforth a republic. Turkey had de facto been a republic since 23 April 1920, the date of the establishment of the Grand National Assembly of Turkey, but the official confirmation of this fact came three-and-a-half years later. On 29 October 1923, the status of the nation as a republic was declared and its official name was proclaimed to be Türkiye Cumhuriyeti ("the Republic of Turkey"). After that, a vote was held in the Grand National Assembly, and Atatürk was elected as the first President of the Republic of Turkey."
input1: "The anniversary marks the significant events of October 29, 1923, when Mustafa Kemal Atatürk announced Turkey's transition to a republic. Although Turkey had been functioning as a republic since the establishment of the Grand National Assembly on April 23, 1920, it wasn't until 1935 that this was officially recognized. The declaration of the republic occurred on October 29, 1923, and the country was officially named Türkiye Cumhuriyeti, which translates to 'the Republic of Turkey.' Subsequently, Atatürk was elected as the inaugural president of the Republic of Turkey through a vote in the Grand National Assembly."
input2: "This day is celebrated to honor the events of 29 October 1923, when Mustafa Kemal Atatürk proclaimed Turkey as a republic. Turkey had effectively been a republic since the Grand National Assembly was founded on April 23, 1920, but it wasn't until 1935 that this was formally acknowledged. On October 29, 1923, the nation was officially declared a republic, and its name was established as Türkiye Cumhuriyeti, meaning 'the Republic of Turkey.' Following this, Atatürk was chosen as the first president of the Republic of Turkey through a voting process in the Grand National Assembly."
input1_ans:
Overall similarity percentage: 85%

| Text1 Sentence                                                                 | Text2 Sentence                                                                 | Similarity Percentage |
|--------------------------------------------------------------------------------|--------------------------------------------------------------------------------|-----------------------|
| The day serves to remember the events of October 29, 1923, when Mustafa Kemal Atatürk proclaimed Turkey to be a republic. | The holiday commemorates the events of 29 October 1923, when Mustafa Kemal Atatürk declared that Turkey was henceforth a republic. | 90%                   |
| Since the Grand National Assembly of Turkey was founded on April 23, 1920, Turkey has been a republic in theory; but, official recognition of this fact didn't occur until 1935. | Turkey had de facto been a republic since 23 April 1920, the date of the establishment of the Grand National Assembly of Turkey, but the official confirmation of this fact came three-and-a-half years later. | 85%                   |
| The nation was proclaimed to be a republic on October 29, 1923, and its official name was announced as Türkiye Cumhuriyeti ("the Republic of Turkey"). | On 29 October 1923, the status of the nation as a republic was declared and its official name was proclaimed to be Türkiye Cumhuriyeti ("the Republic of Turkey"). | 95%                   |
| After that, Atatürk was chosen to serve as the Republic of Turkey's first president in a vote in the Grand National Assembly. | After that, a vote was held in the Grand National Assembly, and Atatürk was elected as the first President of the Republic of Turkey. | 90%                   |

Explanation: The texts exhibit a high degree of similarity in both structure and content, indicating potential plagiarism. The sentences convey the same information with only slight variations in wording.

The anniversary commemorates the pivotal events of October 29, 1923, when Mustafa Kemal Atatürk declared Turkey's establishment as a republic. While Turkey had been operating as a republic since the Grand National Assembly was founded on April 23, 1920, official recognition of this status did not occur until 1935. The republic was formally declared on October 29, 1923, and the nation was named Türkiye Cumhuriyeti, meaning 'the Republic of Turkey.' Following this, Atatürk was elected as the first president of the Republic of Turkey in a vote held by the Grand National Assembly.

| Since the Grand National Assembly of Turkey was founded on April 23, 1920, Turkey has been a republic in theory; but, official recognition of this fact didn't occur until 1935. | Turkey had effectively been a republic since the Grand National Assembly was founded on April 23, 1920, but it wasn't until 1935 that this was formally acknowledged. | 90%                   |
| The nation was proclaimed to be a republic on October 29, 1923, and its official name was announced as Türkiye Cumhuriyeti ("the Republic of Turkey"). | On October 29, 1923, the nation was officially declared a republic, and its name was established as Türkiye Cumhuriyeti, meaning 'the Republic of Turkey.' | 95%                   |
| After that, Atatürk was chosen to serve as the Republic of Turkey's first president in a vote in the Grand National Assembly. | Following this, Atatürk was chosen as the first president of the Republic of Turkey through a voting process in the Grand National Assembly. | 90%                   |

There is a high level of similarity between the two texts, indicating potential plagiarism. The sentences convey the same information with only slight variations in wording and structure.

The text you provided summarizes the historical events surrounding the establishment of the Republic of Turkey on October 29, 1923, and highlights the role of Mustafa Kemal Atatürk in this significant moment. It mentions the founding of the Grand National Assembly on April 23, 1920, and notes that Turkey had been functioning as a republic since then, although formal recognition did not occur until 1935. The text also emphasizes the official declaration of the nation's name as Türkiye Cumhuriyeti, or "the Republic of Turkey," and concludes with Atatürk's election as the first president through a vote in the Grand National Assembly.
